episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features facts about World War II U-boat toilets, Alexander Graham Bell's talking dog, crustaceans using snails as backpacks, and a rock band made up of NASA astronauts. The hosts delve into historical anecdotes, scientific curiosities, and quirky stories from the past and present.

facts.fact: When you went to the toilet on a World War II U-boat, you had to summon a specially trained member of the crew to flush it after you'd been.
Alexander Graham Bell taught his dog to say, "How are you, Grandmama?"
To stop being eaten by predators, some crustaceans wear disgusting-tasting snails as backpacks.
There is a rock band made up entirely of NASA astronauts called MaxQ.
